meanings.definition: Making a certain situation or outcome likely or possible.
meanings.sent1: The conducive weather made the picnic enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: The cozy blankets were conducive to a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy pillows were so conducive that they almost seemed magical.
meanings.sent4: The soft music created a conducive atmosphere for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the room were incredibly conducive to productivity.

meanings.definition: The quality of being helpful or favorable.
meanings.sent1: The conduciveness of teamwork led to success.
meanings.sent2: His positive attitude added to the conduciveness of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The conduciveness of the situation made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The conduciveness of the environment was like a warm hug.
meanings.sent5: The conduciveness of the plan was evident in its flawless execution.
